snippet: The White House said Friday that President Obama had written a letter to the Polish president expressing “regret” for using the term “Polish death camp” this week while honoring a Polish World War II resistance hero.
abstract: Pres Obama apologizes to Polish Pres Bronislaw Komorowski for using the term “Polish death camp” while honoring a Polish World War II resistance hero; Poles had no role in running the death camps operated by Nazi Germany, and many were killed in them.
lead_paragraph: The White House said Friday that President Obama had written a letter to the Polish president expressing “regret” for using the term “Polish death camp” this week while honoring a Polish World War II resistance hero.

headline.main: Poland: A Letter of Regret From Obama
headline.print_headline: Poland: A Letter of Regret From Obama
